title: The godfather of glossies: Nicholas Coleridge on explosive encounters with Sir Philip Green
text:
He’s met everyone from royalty to politicians and pop stars during his 30 years at the top of magazine publishing. Here, Nicholas Coleridge shares his career highlights (and gossip from 15,000 parties) with Celia Walden.

Of all the ‘selected’ memories Nicholas Coleridge has decided to share in his forthcoming autobiography, The Glossy Years, the only one still able to reduce the former Condé Nast president to the stammering Eton schoolboy he once was concerns the Princess of Wales’s breasts.

‘Nicholas, can I ask you something?’ Princess Diana once murmured to Coleridge at a Vogue House luncheon held for former US Vanity Fair editor Graydon Carter. ‘Please be truthful. Did you see the photograph...
